verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, And for \add this\add* I make haste.
I have heard the check of my reproach, And the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
Knowest thou \add not\add* this of old, Since man was placed upon earth,
That the triumphing of the wicked \add is\add* short, And the joy of the hypocrite \add but\add* for a moment?
Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, And his head reach unto the clouds;
\add Yet\add* he shall perish for ever like his own dung: They which have seen him shall say, Where \add is\add* he?
He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: Yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
The eye also \add which\add* saw him shall \add see him\add* no more; Neither shall his place any more behold him.
His children shall \add seek to\add* please the poor, And his hands shall restore their goods.
His bones are full \add of the sin of\add* his youth, Which shall lie down with him in the dust.
Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, \add Though\add* he hide it under his tongue;
\add Though\add* he spare it, and forsake it not; But keep it still within his mouth:
\add Yet\add* his meat in his bowels is turned, \add It is\add* the gall of asps within him.
He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.
He shall suck the poison of asps: The viperâ€™s tongue shall slay him.
He shall not see the rivers, The floods, the brooks of honey and butter.

That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow \add it\add* down: According to \add his\add* substance \add shall\add* the restitution \add be\add*, and he shall not rejoice \add therein\add*.
Because he hath oppressed \add and\add* hath forsaken the poor; \add Because\add* he hath violently taken away a house which he builded not;
Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, He shall not save of that which he desired.
\add There shall\add* none of his meat \add be\add* left; Therefore shall no \add man\add* look for his goods.
In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: Every hand of the wicked shall come \add upon\add* him.
\add When\add* he is about to fill his belly, \add God\add* shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, And shall rain \add it\add* upon him while he is eating.
He shall flee from the iron weapon, \add And\add* the bow of steel shall strike him through.
It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; Yea, the glistering sword cometh out of his gall: Terrors \add are\add* upon him.
All darkness \add shall be\add* hid in his secret places: A fire not blown shall consume him; It shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; And the earth shall rise up against him.
The increase of his house shall depart, \add And his goods shall\add* flow away in the day of his wrath.
This \add is\add* the portion of a wicked man from God, And the heritage appointed unto him by God.
